Job Description: Performing quantitative research, analysis and development on  Group’s electronic/algorithmic execution trading systems. Use statistical/mathematical techniques and knowledge of US equity market structure (and microstructure) to design new trading algorithms and systems, and improve existing ones, with the goal of providing ‘best execution’ on client orders executed thru our systems. The research tasks involve developing research plans, extensive data analysis (usually with large amounts of data on orders, trades and market data) and documenting outcomes as reports and white papers. The development tasks require writing robust software using good design principles and follow practices like continuous integration for efficient development cycles.
Requirement: Bachelor or a Master’s degree in Computer Science, with an advanced degree in a quantitative field like Statistics, Financial Mathematics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, or a directly related field. 2-5 years of experience in software development and 1-3 years in quantitative analysis (statistical analysis - regression analysis, time series analysis and/or machine learning). Strong object oriented design and programming skills using Java (or similar object oriented programming language) is required, with good knowledge of using efficient data structures. Experience working with data/statistical analysis software like Excel, R and Matlab, and familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques. Experience researching large data sets related to trading (tick/market data, orders and trades) is a plus. Knowledge of equity market micro-structure and TCA techniques is a plus. Candidate should be self-motivated, and have the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and work well in a collaborative team environment. Familiarity with some or all of these technologies is required - JUnit testing, Unix environment, multi-threaded programming and NoSQL databases.

Job Description: Lead development of analytical models using statistical, machine learning and data mining methodologies. Advise, help to resolve issues and handle non-standard cases. Drive work on improving the codebase and machine learning lifecycle infrastructure.

Expert level in 5+ classes of algorithms. • Experience implementing scalable, distributed, and highly available systems using Google Cloud. • Experience with data visualization tools and techniques. • Understanding of algorithmic complexity of model training and testing, particularly for real-time and near real-time models. • Proficient in at least one statistical (R, Python) and one programming (Julia, Java, Scala or similar) languages. • Strong skills in data processing using SQL. Desired Characteristics : • Experience with BigQuery or similar data service • Experience with data visualizations • Experience with reinforcement learning based systems. • Working experience with deep learning, particularly in the areas different form computer vision. • Experience with multi-billion record datasets and leading projects that span the disciplines of data science and data engineering • Knowledge of enterprise-level digital analytics platforms (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.) • Experience building streaming data pipelines using Kafka, Spark or Flink • Experience with large-scale video assets • Team oriented and collaborative approach with a demonstrated aptitude and willingness to learn new methods and tools • Pride and ownership in your work and confident representation of your team to other parts of NBCUniversal

The incumbent will be responsible for creating effective strategies to collect data, analyze information, conduct research and design data-driven solutions to support the Global Information Security (GIS), Cyber Security Assurance (CSA) Data Strategy Team. They will be required to translate non-functional/functional requirements into technical designs that include data lineage and aggregation, system interactions, business intelligence and end-to-end workflows. They must develop performance and operational metrics through the identification and reporting of key risk indicators (KRIs) with a strong focus on trending and gap analysis. Analytics and metrics will be used to guide business decisions, uncover new cyber risk trends, and identify opportunities/recommendations. This position will work closely with senior leaders and technology experts to develop detailed business requirements to convert complex analytical and quantitative data into meaningful, understandable visual displays for repeatable consumption by senior leadership and our stakeholders. Required Skills: • Self-starter with the ability to research and recognize relevant data, data patterns and determine the value-add of those to the overall business processes. Must be able to work independently with stakeholders and excel through hands-on learning. • Intermediate to expert knowledge of data collection and structuring concepts. • Intermediate knowledge of data mapping and/or creation of a data dictionary. • Intermediate knowledge of data visualization concepts with the ability to translate data into meaningful business context. • Intermediate knowledge of structured query language (SQL) and SDLC concepts • Strong organization and communication skills. Position will require task prioritization, requirement creation, presentations to senior leadership and interaction with technical/non-technical stakeholders. • Creative and proactive problem solver – ability to quickly grasp what the team needs and offer suggestions above and beyond what they are asking for to determine the best available solution • Basic to intermediate application of statistics principles to include standard deviations, deriving populations and sampling rates, probability and distribution, and non-graphical exploratory data analysis. • Ability to coach and walk others through statistical processes so that they understand how solutions were derived. • Willingness to work with technology teams that thrive on idea sharing and innovation. • Previous experience in managing large data sets, query tools, etc • Ability to prototype ideas into workable solutions that will translate into long-term automation projects for the technology teams. • Must be able to work independently on a team that is geographically separated. • Intermediate use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Visio • Expert use of Microsoft Excel to include pivot tables, macros, visualizations, and queries. • Track record in delivering metrics frameworks, executive dashboards, BI Visualization, or similar projects at the departmental scale (100+ people) of a Fortune 500 organization. Desired Skills: • Data mapping and analysis skills to include mapping dissimilar data structures across multiple systems of record. • Requirement gathering concepts. Ability to work with multiple stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate those into technical requirements. • Experience with SQL, Python, and Business Intelligence (BI) tools • Data design/development experience in Hadoop, JIRA, and BI Tools/analytics platforms (i.e., Arcadia, Tableau, Microstrategy, SharePoint) preferred. • Experience with MySQL database management • Experience with the Agile methodology Specific skillset desired • Proficient in SQL, Python, SDLC concepts, and Microsoft Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) including: Expertise in Excel macros, graphs, and VBA • Data design/development experience in Hadoop, JIRA, and BI Tools (Tableau, Microstrategy, SharePoint, and/or Arcadia) preferred. • Experience with MySQL database management • Completing data analytics that will be used to guide business decisions; interpreting analysis into strategic and tactical recommendation and presenting results in a professional/compelling manner
Requirement: Data, Sql, Data analysis, Business analysis, Data governance, Data science, Data extraction, Microsoft excel, Tableau

Job Description: This team will work closely with the issue mgmt. business consultant team on the issues identified within the retail lending domain. Once an issue has been identified by the BC team, the issues is passed to this team of data analyst to look at the issue and the impact of the issue, The data analyst will analyze the data to see what the impact is and how many consumers have been impacted. Data Investigation & Analytics Members of this team perform the following functions: • Map data flow, source data, and perform analytics to support and determine issue root causes and short term fix • Map data flow, source data and perform analytics to determine impacted customers / look-backs • Map data flow, source data and perform analytics to calculate impact • Build ongoing controls to ensure effectiveness • Serves as control point for consistency by reviewing work being performed by other teams to determine impacted customers / look-backs, and calculate impacts • Ensure sustainable controls and data infrastructure on-going A successful member of this team has deep analytical capabilities, can build data structures, has strong reporting capabilities, can take complex concepts and break them down, knows the right questions to ask when the data is not easily available, and has a sense of urgency in execution.

Customer service experience working directly with end user/customers. 3. Experience with 911 telecom services - Any Level of understanding.

Job Description: FieldLevel is seeking a strong analytical mind excited to use the the tools of statistics and data science to help make software people love to use. As an entry level data analyst you'll get hands on experience using data to build better software. You'll work side-by-side with domain experts, UX designers, and application developers. The job of the entry level data analyst requires a breadth of knowledge. You should know fundamental methods of statistical analysis. You should have exposure to modern applications of statistics like machine learning, behavioral analytics, and experimental design. You should know SQL, R or Python, and the most common libraries. And because you'll be building software for humans, you should be excited to learn the best ways to gather data both actively and passively as people use our product. Few people are entry level candidates are experts in all of these areas, but you should be well versed in some, with a working knowledge of the others and an appetite to gain expertise in several areas. What you'll do: Answer tough questions that come up by analyzing our data and provide insights gained from analyzing data. Design and deploy new datasets to our data catalog to help teams accomplish objectives Manage analytical escalation: help team members learn how to answer simple questions themselves, provide your own analysis to answer more difficult queries, and collaborate on the hardest questions with the rest of the data science team. Assess and advise on data collection opportunities of new product feature work. Assess and advise on ML opportunities of new product feature work. Monitor and analyze outcomes of experiments the team runs and product features the team deploys. Assist data engineers with pipeline construction
Requirement: Are humble in the workplace, but you can defend ideas that you believe in. Strong mathematical problem-solving skills Some experience with experimental design and data schemas Sense of when a question can be answered with data and how to do it. Some experience with ML methods Good at explaining general and in particular with plots and numbers. Can speak clearly and simply when discussing analytical topics (doesn't intimidate people with complexity) Proficient with data science programming languages like Python, R, SQL, Regex, Scala. Proficient with data science software platforms like Jupyter, Tableau, Power BI, Spark. Interested in quickly cycling through computational knowledge building: explore hypothesize test discover report Personality Rigorous, Logical, Skeptical, Proactive, Curious Education and Experience BS or higher in data science related field Online course work in ML or statistical analysis Bonus if Past experience with social science research Loves power analysis, conjoint analysis, ML, data visualization

Company Name: National Association of State Workforce Agencies

Job Description: We are seeking a Data Scientist or Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics Center of Excellence department.  The Data & Analytics Center of Excellence is an applied business support function leveraging advances in data management, data science and analytics to provide senior leaders across the Enterprise with information, insights and direction to help meet their business goals. With your help, we can continue to unlimit the possibilities! What would I do? As a Data Scientist or Data Engineer, you will work collaboratively with business unit leaders across the Enterprise to support initiatives focusing on customer and financial advisor acquisition and growth, customer retention, and operational efficiency initiatives. Depending upon your background and area of specialization, you may perform data mining and data driven analyses, develop interactive data visualization solutions or automate reports and dashboards, establish test vs control group designs, and implement predictive models using machine-learning algorithms, often in an automated production environment.  With multiple business units to support, you would work with numerous internal and external data sources, IT partners, vendors and CRM platforms to identify, extract and manage data for analytics and business intelligence purposes. In this role, you will work directly with business leaders to understand their objectives, develop project plans to address their needs, and implement and communicate data driven solutions through customized presentations. This is a great opportunity if you are a recent graduate from a Master’s program or have several years of professional experience in a data and analytics role, with a strong background in information management and/or applied statistics.  Qualified candidates must have a B.S or M.S in a quantitative field such as data science, data analytics, statistics, applied mathematics, economics, computer science, or information systems.  Working knowledge of R or Python, as well as SQL, Tableau and Excel, is required.  Also required is the ability to work with datamarts and relational databases, to extract, build and join data. Exposure to big data platforms, for example, KNIME, Databricks, Azure, is helpful, but not required.  Experience using statistical techniques for supervised and unsupervised learning and model development (for example, regression, classification, time series, clustering, survival analysis, random forests and ensemble methods, analysis of variance, etc.) is also helpful. Tell me about Western & Southern Financial Group As a part of the Western & Southern family, you would enjoy a competitive benefit plan including medical, dental, prescription, vision, long-term and short-term disability coverage, tuition reimbursement, a free fitness center, paid time off and holidays, a 401(k) plan with a company match, AND a defined benefit pension plan! We offer discounted parking or bus subsidies, free breakfast and lunch in our onsite café, as well as numerous employee discounts.

STEM degrees are preferred. 3+ years of hands-on experience doing quantitative analysis, modeling, optimization and/or statistics. Experience utilizing Python (or similar language) and SQL. Job Description: The Data Scientist is a high-impact role that will work closely with our Customer, Sales, and Operations teams to help drive data-driven decisions that accelerate BusPatrol’s efficient growth. If storytelling and impacting operational decisions through numbers is exciting to you, we want to hear from you! This is a high visibility role that will be interfacing with business leaders on a regular basis, defining team roadmap and gathering requirements to deliver innovative solutions. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, highly analytical, curious, and comfortable diving deep into large data sets to unearth insights. Our environment is fast-paced and requires someone who is enthusiastic, flexible, detail-oriented, analytical, and comfortable working with multiple teams and competing priorities. Apply excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to drive business decisions in a dynamic environment to deliver customer benefit and performance analytics Work both independently and collaboratively with other scientists, engineers, designers, BI developers, and product managers on complex projects that deliver value to BusPatrol Excellent communication skills and ability to structure a compelling storyline to present a narrative using actionable data-driven insights Ability to conceptualize business issues or opportunities, formulate hypotheses and goals, define KPIs and make appropriate recommendations Build world-class prescriptive and predictive models to solve business problems in a fast-moving environment Leverage internal and external data to synthesize nuggets of insights that explain underlying trends in the automated enforcement ecosystem Identify opportunities for automation to drive scalability, improve efficiency and productivity of the broader team Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively synthesize insights (including model theory, selection tradeoffs, and limitations) to executives and/or customers In time, hire, train, mentor, and lead a robust data analytics team for BusPatrol

Job Description: As a Data Scientist at CrowdStreet, you’ll be a part of a small and expanding Data Engineering Team, leveraging a maturing data warehouse platform. You’ll be diving deep into Snowflake, centralizing business definitions and ubiquitous language, identifying gaps in needed data, and helping expose areas to be cleaned and better transformed. As business needs and available data have both been identified, you’ll start building out statistical and predictive models to enhance analysis of marketing and investor relations. You’ll continue training and adding models to aspire towards the ideal investor journey, while partnering with the data team to find new data to bring into your domain.
Requirement: Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in a related quantitative field (Data Science, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Economics). 3+ years of relevant working experience manipulating data sets, building statistical models and recommendation engines, performing time-series forecasting, marketing trend analysis, etc. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Experience with modern Machine Learning frameworks and/or platforms (Tensorflow, PyTorch, SageMaker). Technical/Functional Competencies Exceptional at assessing data to determine behaviors, offer recommendations, identify trends, and return predictions, using proven approaches of statistical analysis and machine learning. Comfortable in Cloud-native services (AWS), Data Warehouses & Data Lakes - Snowflake a plus. Familiar with ELT tools such as Stitch, dbt_, data cleaning tools. Strong communication skills, you’ll be working with every segment of the business, collecting requirements, understanding behaviors, and collaborating with product & engineering. Familiar and capable in the full analytics stack, analyzing and ingressing new data sources, specifying and/or building transformations, and materializing in data warehouses. Working with Java, REST and Python Previous backend\data engineering experience will be valuable on this small, but growing team. Financial, real estate or marketing experience is a plus.
